isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Power Cylinder - Installation - Connecting Rod and Piston Installation

step1.para: Turn crankshaft so that the number 1 connecting rod journal is at the bottom of its stroke.

note.para: Before installing piston and connecting rod assembly, make sure all piston cooling tubes are in place.

step1.para: Coat piston and piston rings with clean engine oil. Coat cylinder walls, crankshaft journals, and piston cope with clean engine oil.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the "CAM V8" stamped on top of the piston must be oriented towards the camshaft side of the crankcase, toward center of engine.

note.para: Pistons are interchangeable between the VT 365 and MaxxForce™ 5 diesel engines.

step1.para:
Place piston in Piston Ring Compressor (cope) to compress rings and ease the installation of piston and connecting rod assembly into the crankcase. See Special Service Tools
.

note.para: Make certain that connecting rod and cap bearing surfaces have been wiped clean of any oil or residue.

step1.para: Install bearing shells in connecting rod and cap. Coat bearing shell in connecting rod with clean engine oil.
Carefully insert connecting rod and start piston into the top end of the cylinder bore until cope is against the top of the cylinder.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use caution not to damage piston cooling tubes when installing connecting rod and piston assemblies.

step1.para: Once piston and connecting rod assembly have been inserted in cylinder bore, use the handle (wood or plastic) of a hammer to tap piston in crankcase bore. Guide connecting rod in place on crankshaft.

figure.caption: Orientation of piston in cylinder bore
Connecting rod and cap matching identification numbers

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not alter or damage the fractured mating surfaces of the connecting rod and cap.

step1.para: Apply clean engine oil to connecting rod bolt hole threads and bearing shell in cap before installing bolts.

Assemble cap to connecting rod with matching identification code on same crankshaft journal from which it was removed. Be certain that the longer leg of the connecting rod and the "CAM V8" stamp on piston crown are oriented towards the camshaft.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not use air powered tools when installing connecting rod bolts. This may cause seizure of connecting rod bolts.

figure.caption: Torquing the connecting rod cap bolts

step1.para:
Install and tighten connecting rod bolts evenly to the initial and final torque values. See special torque
.
Repeat installation procedure for remaining connecting rod and piston assemblies.
Check connecting rod side clearance with feeler gauge. See procedure in removal section Piston and Connecting Rod Checks in this section.
Complete the engine rebuild and reinstall all safety guards, shields and covers after servicing the engine.
Make sure all tools, covers, loose parts and service equipment are removed from the engine area after all work is done.
